intro: Descurainia sophia var. densiflora, commonly known as denseflower bladderweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense clusters of small, yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands and along streambanks.
